fields.summary: Add ability to configure a custom renderer in the Activity fields

fields.description: Create a customfield of any type and append it to only create and edit issue operation screens. This customfield when configured in the issue navigator column will be shown and can be exported to excel with out any problem but not on Microsoft word. I have attached here in screen shots of the issue navigator and the exported files in excel and word format.

fields.description:
We suggest to implement an additional feature or plugin for Billing hours, most of the time the worklog time and billing time will be different. By this jira can be integrated to other CRM or accounts software like Sage. 

- I searched but could not find any feature similar to this. If there is any other options then do let us know.

Thank you
fields.summary: Billing Hours

fields.description:
Came across this snippet when creating a dashboard:

bq. Alternatively, choose 'Blank dashboard' to create a dashboard with no portlets.

Perhaps just grep the i18 files for the word 'portlets'? It should be 'gadget', I suspect almost everywhere.
fields.summary: change portlets to gadgets in i18 file

fields.description: For instance we currently expose HitCollector which is deprecated in v2.9 and removed in v3.
fields.summary: Alter JIRA's Issue Searching API to allow us to upgrade to Lucene v3

fields.description:
As many issues, especially client reported issues, and feature requests may be directly related to multiple JIRA projects, it is currently necessary to clone issues for each project that is affected.  Which in effect is just duplicating information and wasting time. 

Maintaining and synchronizing these issues across multiple projects is a major hassle, and would easily be resolved if issue could belong to multiple projects/fix versions.
fields.summary: Allow issue to belong to multiple fix versions/ projects.
The Labels field appears to treat "not set" differently than other fields
Easy User Export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23782].
  {panel}

Previous to LDAP integration, we had users such as john, sam, bob, phil, melissa, linda, etc. Now that we have implemented LDAP integration our naming convention is <first initial of first name>-<last name>, (jsmith, ssmith, bwilson, pbears), so the users who have local jira accounts can't utilize their LDAP accounts without starting from scratch. 

Can there be a process developed where we can migrate (user: linda, account:local)'s data to (user:lsmith, account:ldap)?

Users would really like to use one password for all sites (without having to set it to be the same in JIRA) and have that password sync with LDAP. This works great for new users who are using the accounts integrated w/ LDAP, but old users cannot do this :(

Help!
fields.summary: Create migration process for local users to have data migrated over to LDAP account

fields.description: we would like to be able to include numbers as well as letters in the three digit prefix used for Jira IDs
fields.summary: we would like to be able to include numbers as well as letters in the three digit prefix used for Jira IDs

fields.description:
The Gadget "Assigned to me" contains a hard coded filter, that only shows "unresolved" tickets. This leads to the problem, that after the QA measures a ticket could get reassigned with the resolution "incomplete" and won't appear anymore in the gadget.
So I'd suggest to make this gadget configurable, that you can cselect the resolutions to get dispayed within the result set.
fields.summary: Editing the filter of the "Assigned to me" gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23777].
  {panel}

After creating a user via SOAP, JIRA will send out a notification to the created user email. But the email notification contains incomplete information whereby the information on the user responsible for the action is null. Below is the example of the notification sent:
{quote}
A JIRA account has been created for you at:

http://localhost:8080

This is either because an administrator has created an account for you,
or because you have been assigned to an issue.

You can change your password here:

http://localhost:8080/secure/ViewProfile.jspa

Here are the details of your account:
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Username: soapuser
Email: email@live.com.my
Full Name: soapuser
Password: soapuser
(If you forget your password, you can retrieve it via the "Forgot Password" link on the sign up page)
*This action was initiated by null (null).*

-- 
This message is automatically generated by JIRA.
-
If you think it was sent incorrectly contact one of the administrators: http://localhost:8080/secure/Administrators.jspa
{quote}

Steps to reproduce the bug:
# Run JIRA with _Accept remote API calls_ turned on
# Run a SOAP client with createUser() method to create a new user
# User is created, notification is sent

Tested in JIRA 4.0.1, 4.1.2, 4.2.1, the bug occurs in all the mentioned version.
fields.summary: Email notification contains the message '_This action was initiated by null (null)_' when creating a user via SOAP
Modify TrustedApplicationsManager so that it does not assume a user is configuring trusted apps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23766].
  {panel}

In the API docs at http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/latest/com/atlassian/configurable/XMLObjectConfigurationFactory.html it states

"The Object Configuration must be unique as a user will set there own parameters on the object during its lifetime."

This should read
"The Object Configuration must be unique as a user will set their own parameters on the object during its lifetime."
fields.summary: Homophone issue in API documentation

fields.description:
Problem: If, when verifying the database connection settings on startup, Jira is unable to connect to the remote database and logs messages "cannot create Poolable Connection Factory", and/or "connection refused: connect". It will retry repeatedly. If it is still unable to connect after 5 mins or so, it will restart -- but in restarting it does not remove the lock on the home directory.

This makes jira unusable until the lock file is deleted.

Fix: After the DB connection attempts time out, and before restart, remove the home directory lock.

This happens on restart when Windows update runs, so it may be affected by or affect JRA-17768 or JRA-20311.
fields.summary: Jira does not release home directory lock if DB connection refused on startup

fields.description:
When you click on the scrollbar on the issue link dropdown, see screenshot, the dropdown disappears.
This happens in IE7, IE8, it works in Firefox.
fields.summary: Issue Link Dropdown disappears when clicking on the scrollbar

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23759].
  {panel}

Hi Guys,

When you make a change to the status of an issue the email notification is sent showing the changelog which is great but the values shown include the field ID's, for example 

Field	                           Original Value	New Value

Change By   Joe Boyce on 22/Feb/11 10:59 AM

Status	                           Assigned [ 3 ]	Committed [ 10001 ]

I have also attached a screenshot of this

Is there a way to hide the field ID and just show the value on its own

Many thanks,

Joe
fields.summary: Hide Field ID values in email notifications

fields.description:
At current state, attachments in JIRA are stored inside {{attachments/project-name}}, in the hierarchy below:
{code}
- attachments
 |- project-name
   |- issue key
{code}

Since attachments are associated with issue keys, this could pose a problem for those on a Linux/UNIX platform. The [ext3 filesystem|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ext3#Functionality] can only have a maximum of 32,000 subdirectories per directory. The [ext4 filesystem|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ext4#Features] has fixed this limitation and increase its size to 64,000 subdirectories per directory.

The problem creeps in when you have 65,000 issues per project. If this was the case, then JIRA would not be able to save any more attachments and this would be problematic.
fields.summary: Attachment Storage vs Linux Filesystems
resource leakage and misleading log message when a bundled plugin gets upgraded

fields.description:
The FileService is now limited to only look at files inside the JIRA_HOME/import/mail directory.
To be able to distinguish between files related to different projects / issuetypes etc. we need the ability to be able to specify a sub-directory and a handler will only process the files inside this sub-directory. Currently all FileService(s) and handler(s) will look at the same dir and have to work themself which files they have to process.
fields.summary: FileService doesn't allow to specify a sub-directory inside the import/mail directory

fields.description:
Hello,

Refering to Jira-documentation one have to use binlog_format=row in my.cnf as of MySQL 5.1.5 when running jira and InnoDB.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Cannot+Create+Issues+when+Using+MySQL+with+Binary+Logging

MySQL uses REPEATABLE-READ isolation level by default in 5.1 so this should be the preferable way to run transactions with MySQL and Innodb.

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/set-transaction.html#isolevel_repeatable-read

Our server config uses statementbased replication (and we want to keep that) and REPEATABLE-READ globaly. Since JIRA overides this settings by setting its SESSION isolation level to READ-COMMITTED it cannot run DML-statements like INSERT. 

So we consider this as a bug in Jira not to use the recommened isolation level REPEATABLE-READ.


KR,
Thomas
fields.summary: Jira does not use recommended mysql transaction isolation level REPEATABLE-READ

fields.description:
Hello,

It's the first time I'm reporting the issue to Jira community.
Here are the facts about our problem.
1. The jira users are logged out very often. 
2. There is no fixed time when the user will be logged out. Sometimes users will never get logged out for whole of the session and sometimes it will be very frequent, say 3-4 times in within 5 minutes.
3. No logs were seen related with this issue.
4. Sometimes we've noticed the pattern that whenever we click on Tempo link in Jira, the user is logged out immediately.

Any help would be highly appreciated regarding this.
I can provide you any other information if required.
fields.summary: Jira Users Logged Out Quite Often

fields.description:
I used the CVS importer successfully to import issues from a custom issue management system.
Issues are properly imported with the original creation/update time.

Now I'd like to replay the workflow history but when executed, the current time is taken for the change date.

Adding a new property 'changedTime' or 'created' to jira:TransitionWorkflow would allow to better reflect the old system history.
fields.summary: jira:TransitionWorkflow tag enhancement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23747].
  {panel}

Ehcache 1.7.0+ will periodically phone home and emit a log message if there is a newer version available. This isn't a useful check when ehcache is shipped as a library in another product.

Quartz does similar.

Even if you aren't shipping 1.7.0+ (yet), you might as well add the check now.

JIRA (at least 4.3) has a transient dependency on ehcache.
fields.summary: Disable ehcache and quartz phone-home timers.

fields.description:
Project names longer than 150 characters are not practical. Project titles should be restricted to 150 characters and a relevant error message should be displayed if the project name exceeds this limit. 

This issue is related to: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-1483
fields.summary: Limit title of Projects to 150 characters

fields.description:
I recently changed the MySQL tests InnoDB like we tell our customers to do. These tests then started deadlocking on the restore. Its not 100% reliable but it has happend at least twice on different batches since I made the change. We need to work out if this is a real bug, or configuration error or something else.

Import is multi-threads and we may have multiple threads writing to the one table. This could cause deadlocks on lock escalation.
fields.summary: MySQL  InnoDB  import fails occasionaly with deadlocks

fields.description:
I would love to see the ability to use wildcards when searching through labels.

We use labels to indicate deployment (release) dates. It would be nice to be able to see a list of releases that matched the year and month, for example:

release_2011_02_*

Would bring up tickets with labels:
release_2011_02_20
release_2011_02_22
release_2011_02_28
fields.summary: Labels Field Wildcards

fields.description: I have being working with another aplication at work which has also the ability to design internal workflows pretty much like JIRA. It also has its steps and transitions, etc... However the one thing this applications does which would be a real enhancement on JIRA is that when you're looking at the workflow steps and transitions, on the side it also shows you graphically how does your steps and transitions are represented and linked between the multiple steps. This is a huge impact for the person building the workflow on helping to understand and visualize much faster if the end results is ok.
fields.summary: Workflor Graph Representation

fields.description: Today I can only upload files after an issue is created so I reference non-existing files as I type issue description. It could be better if files were uploaded before creating an issue so once it is created it doesn't need to be updated.
fields.summary: Provide a way to upload files *before* an issue is created
Provide an option to preview an issue before creating it
Change single button keyboard shortcuts so that they dont include operating system shortcuts
Alternative container providers implementation

fields.description:
Otherwise valid credentials fail if Save Password checkbox is activated in JIRA Repository Settings in Atlassian Eclipse plugin.
JIRA version v4.1.1#522 (Crowd 2.0.1) , Atlassian connector for Eclipse 3.0.0.v20110210 (as well as some previous versions).

Namely, if I enter my credentials and click "Validate Settings" button then "Authentication credentials are valid" is coming. 
If, without any other changes I activate "Save Password" checkbox and again click "Validate Settings" then "Unable to authenticate with repository. Login credentials invalid." is coming. If I deactivate the checkbox and click again - "Authentication credentials are valid".
fields.summary: Otherwise valid credentials fail if Save Password checkbox is activated in JIRA Repository Settings in Atlassian Eclipse plugin

fields.description:
When Sloven/Slovak-based UTF-8 encoding characters are used in the Wiki text renderer-based field, some of the characters are not displayed when typed (black blocks appeared). However, when previewed, the characters are shown.

Steps to Reproduce:
# Type in any Sloven/Slovak characters inside a Wiki text renderer-based field. Some of the characters won't be shown and appear as black blocks (čćđž, for e.g.)
# Preview the field, and the typed characters are shown.
# Create the issue, and the characters are shown.

*Screenshot:* while entering text
!description_charset_problem.png|thumbnail!

*Screenshot:* while previewing text
!description_charset_problem2.png|thumbnail!

Note: Only appeared in Windows on Mozilla Firefox browsers. Does not appear in Linux and Mac OS, as well as Internet Explorer and Safari browsers.
fields.summary: Character Encoding Issue With Wiki Text Renderer, Firefox and Windows

fields.summary: Fix documentation: Replacing a JIRA Component with a plugin 1 is not possible

fields.description:
By right, these are the custom fields that should only be showing option values in "User Is In Group Custom Field"
- Group Picker
- Multi Group Picker

However, here are the following custom fields that are showing inside the list of "User Is In Group Custom Field"
- Radio Button
- Multi Checkboxes
- Select List
- Multi Select

And, here are the custom fields list that are not being affected:
- Cascading Select
- Multi User Picker
- Date Picker
- Date Time
- Free Text Field (unlimited text)
- Labels
- Number Field 
- Project Picker
- Read-only Text Field
- Single Version Picker
- Text Field
- URL Field
- User Picker
- Version Picker

The steps to reproduce this bug are as follow:
# Create a new custom field of either 'Radio Button' / 'Multi Checkboxes' / 'Select List' / 'Multi Select' type.
# Create a new custom field of 'Group Picker' and 'Multi Group Picker'
# Click on any inactive workflows and try to edit any workflow transition
# In workflow condition, add a new workflow transition condition by selecting 'User Is In Group Custom Field'
# In 'Add Parameters to Condition' page, you can see that there are also other custom fields beside 'Group Picker' or 'Multi Group Picker' is shown as well
fields.summary: Adding a workflow transition condition of 'User Is In Group Custom Field' is showing some other custom fields

fields.description: When adding watches to an issue the regular submit form keyboard shortcut (Ctrl+S on Firefox on OS X) does not work.
fields.summary: Add Watches page does not respond to submit form keyboard short cut

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It's currently quite cumbersome to copy an individual comment in Jira without resorting to mouse-dragging or shift-selecting with the keyboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be awesome if each comment included a copy icon (beside the permalink / delete icons), that copied the contents of the comment to the clipboard OR
A keyboard shortcut was available to copy the contents of the currently select comment.
fields.summary: Add copy link and/or keyboard shortcut for copying individual comments

fields.description:
{noformat}*text JRA-23728*{noformat} generates *text JRA-23728* whereas I expect *text* *JRA-23728*.

To get the latter, one must re-type the stars right before and after the Jira key as follows {noformat}*text* *JRA-23728*{noformat}
fields.summary: Wiki text effects won't work with a text that includes a Jira issue key

As administrator, it is impossible to add new avatar project in the commun avatar repository.
Jira should let administrator to add commun avatars corresponding to Jira project type.
Further more, these avatars could have been customized by the company.
That way, Team Leader could choose more specific avatar without having choosen it in the file system.
Support told me how to add it by modifying the database. This solution is too complex and should be available in the UI interface of Jira administration .
fields.summary: Impossible to add an avatar in the library

fields.description:
steps needed to reproduce the bug:
# attach an image file consisting '&' in the name e.g._atl&support.png_
# use image markups to display image in the comment filed:
{noformat}
!atl&support.png!
!atl&support.png|thumbnail!
{noformat}
# The following error message is displayed:
{noformat}
Unable to render embedded object: File (atl&support.png) not found.
Unable to render embedded object: File (atl&support.png) not found.
{noformat}
as per the following example:
!atl&support.png!
!atl&support.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: image markup is not rendered correctly, if the file name consists the amp character '&'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23720].
  {panel}

Plugins (such as the commit acceptance plugin), when converted to v2 plugins, have their i18n break if they use the "magic".

The "magic" is that they have an action class Foo which extends JiraWebActionSupport, and a Foo.properties file right next to the class file in their jar with i18n keys, and no mention of it in code or plugin descriptor.  This method of i18n "just works" for v1 plugins but breaks when you make them v2 plugins.

When that happens, the following shows up in the logs for every key referenced:
{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2011-02-16 21:52:23,785 http-2990-2 DEBUG admin 352x273x1 1wxv13h 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CommitAcceptanceConfigure.jspa [commitacceptance.server.action.ConfigureAction] Cannot find key 'commitacceptance.prompt.unsavedConfig'
{noformat}

You can reproduce this using the commit acceptance plugin source located here:
http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/jira/jira-commitacceptance-plugin/trunk

By applying the following patch:
{noformat}
diff --git a/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml b/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml
index eeefc70..d8bed9d 100644
--- a/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml
+++ b/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-<atlassian-plugin key="${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}" name="${project.name}">
+<atlassian-plugin key="${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}" name="${project.name}" plugins-version="2">
{noformat}

mrdon in #atlassiandev on freenode has confirmed that this should be a bug.

Thanks!
fields.summary: webwork1 "magic" for i18n is broken for v2 plugins

fields.description:
When an Autocomplete/Frother control dropdown has scrollbars, attempting to scroll using the mouse in IE will dismiss the dropdown.

This was broken in JIRA 4.2.3 onwards, I suspect by the fix for JRA-23183 .

To reproduce:
1) Go to the View Issue page in IE7 or IE8.
2) Click the "label" pencil icon.
3) Click the arrow to show the dropdown.
4) Attempt to scroll the dropdown by dragging the scrollbar, or clicking in an open space on the scrollbar gutter.
The dropdown will disappear.
fields.summary: Autocomplete menu scrollbars are dismissed onclick in IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23718].
  {panel}

Hi, some of our users have a large number of search filters (125+).  This can make life very difficult for them, when they try to Manage Filters (Issues > Manage Filters).  A given filter may only take a few seconds to update, but with so many filters the page overall can take 6-8 minutes to refresh.  

If the user is trying to work just a few filters, for example to share with other users, then they still have to take the performance hit for the whole list, despite only being focused on a few filters.

We would like to request that the Manage Filters page be paginated, and show only a few filters (or a configurable bound) per page.  Or allow a user to configure which sub-set of filters is actively visible.  

Note that the key feature is that the page needs to show the filter and the number of matches for the filter.  We did try and use:

https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JOUT/Filter+List+Plugin

But it does not meet this key requirement, and its buggy/difficult to use :( 

However if pagination can be added to the Manage Filters page, it should resolve the resolve the performance issue in a reasonable way.
fields.summary: Filter Management Should be Paginated
/auth/session returns incorrect URL to user in "self" attribute

fields.description: In the JIRA documentation it states that if multiple events are fired then multiple emails will be sent. In this case I am attaching a file to an issue and making a comment at the same time. No email is sent to me saying that the issue has been commented. I can explicitly create a comment on the issue and then it works but in my mind it should send an email in both cases.

fields.description:
When using a dark theme (e.g. [Darklooks|http://solitudo.net/software/awesome/themes/]), textfield form types in JIRA transformed into a dark background. Also, the text for the textfield maintain its original color (black) and thus, makes input inside the textfield to be unreadable.

Screenshots below:
!snapshot4.png|thumbnail! !snapshot5.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Darker Themes in Gnome Result in Textfield Form Types in JIRA to be Unreadable

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create an issue using Firefox (3.6.13)
# Click on "Browse" on attachment field and select a file
# The upload path is displayed in the attachment field
# Click on browse again and cancel
# The existing path still remain

*Finding*
# There is no way to cancel the attachment if user change their mind
# This is actually a known bug in Firefox  as stated in bug report below:
#- https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=431098
# This does not happen to other browser such as IE 8 and chrome 8.
# This problem doesn't occur in JIRA 4.2 or above due to the UI improvement done since JIRA 4.2

*Workaround*
* Upgrade to JIRA 4.2 or above
* Use other Browser
* Cancel the issue creation/editing screen and do it again.
fields.summary: Not able to cancel attachment's field path

Apologies if this is a duplicate, but when searching, I did not find this issue.

When using the "E-mail this Issue" form, there's a preview button just above the "Body text" box on the top-right. However, this preview button currently does not do anything and returns this error (in Chrome):
Uncaught ReferenceError: toggleRenderPreview is not defined
(anonymous function) com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue.action.EmailThisIssue!view.jspa:438
onclick com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue.action.EmailThisIssue!view.jspa:439
fields.summary: E-mail Issue Preview not working
Similar to SAO Credit Footnote/FAS 161 - I would like to add the following group:

fields.description: After login, when you go to the Create Issue button and then you have to choose a project. In Internet Explorer (tested and reproduced in version 8) Opening the project drop down after a certain period of time (seconds) the project drop down closes and doesn't give you enough time to select a project. Taking account that the JIRA instance in case has a big number of projects and that you may have to spend some time reading to select which project do you want to use.
fields.summary: Project Dropdown closes after seconds

fields.description:
When you set a specific filter to be used in Issue Statistics Gadget, it doesn't work if you try to sort data by 'Total'. A error saying that the resource cannot be accessed is displayed.

!support_ss007.jpg|thumbnail!
Selected sort by Total on filter options.

!support_ss005.jpg|thumbnail!
An resource request attempt error is displayed.

Also, the following appears in the atlassian-jira.log:

{code}WARN user 884x1554x1 mkvbh5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/gadget/1.0/stats/generate [jira.jql.query.GenericClauseQueryFactory] The 'xxxx' clause does not support the = operator.{code}

Probably it happens because there are issues returned by the filter with a custom field that was setted as the statistic type of the gadget as NONE.

*WORKAROUND*

* You can append to your filter query AND <customfield> is not EMPTY. It'll avoid to catch issues with related custom field as null value.

* Also, don't use the system null value to this related custom field (leaving it blank). Create a new value called "NULL" and set it as default custom field value instead.
!support_ss008.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Statistics Gadget Crashes due to Unsupported Operator
Road Map Gadget displays 'No Issues' for each version of a project even though there are issues for each of them
missing 'filter operations' also in the simple search mode
Ability to perform a bulk random password reset for users per project

fields.description:
In General configuration, Base URL is "http://jiraeti.mycompany.ch/jira"

I open a ticket from URL: http://jiraeti.mycompany.ch/jira/browse/TESTPROJECT-79

After screenshot insertion with "Attach" button in the applet,
the browser is redirected to http://jiraeti.mycompany.ch/browse/TESTPROJECT-79
and of course it fails with a 404.

By the way, the screenshot is properly attached to the issue.

As standalone package use "ROOT", the problem does not appear as redirection is
valid. When deployed in a non-root context path, redirection is invalid.

Please fix the redirection after attachment and describe files to patch on my JIRA 4.2.1 setup.
Thank you in advance.
fields.summary: Invalid redirection to issue after screenshot attachment

fields.description: A very frequent task is to change the time remaining for an issue based on greater understanding of the task, or to set the time remaining to zero before resolving it (needed for good burndowns). Currently the only way to do that is to bring up the issue itself, select Edit, find the correct field, and change it. Some way to do this from one or more of those helpful action menus that appear at the end of issues in filter results, or list of subtasks, would be very nice.
fields.summary: Add set time remaining to action menus

that the name of the user who uploaded an attachment

Now in 4.2 it's gone again.
Could we have it back?

Here's a screenshot of Jira 4.1
We really really like how the name of the user 
who uploaded the attachment 
is always displayed on the default issue view
!uploader name present jira 4.1.png|thumbnail!

Now sad face :( it's missing in Jira 4.2

By the way, sorting attachments in Jira 4.2 rocks
so thanks for that
fields.summary: show the user who uploaded an attachment, again, like it was in jira 4.1

fields.description: As per our documentation on [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] we only support Microsoft SQL Server 2005 and 2008 with JTDS 1.2.3 driver, however the JTDS 1.2.2 driver is the one that comes bundled with JIRA. This driver that comes bundled in JIRA should be updated to JTDS 1.2.4.
fields.summary: Bundle in JIRA the correct driver for Microsoft SQL Server

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Create a new custom field of *Select List* type
# Inside the option, fill in any long string value
# Using IE 7 or IE 8, during issue creation, clicking on the dropdown of Select List custom field will give you the following result:
!SelectListCutOff.jpg|thumbnail!

This problem does not happen in Firefox. In addition to that, this problem does not occur in previous JIRA versions (JIRA 4.0.x and JIRA 4.1.x).
fields.summary: Dropdown list for Select List custom field does not show full string length in IE 7 and IE 8

fields.description:
When building plugin to extend jira 4.2.2 menu I used the code below to add thumbnail (icon) in front of a menu chice a strange effect appeared. Check the attachment.


.........

<web-resource key="image_icon" name="My Plugin Downloadable Resources">
<resource type="download" name="images/" location="images/"/>
</web-resource>
...............

<web-item ..................>
.............
   <icon width="16" height="16">
   <link linkId="test_link" >/download/resources/${jira.apps.gadgets}.${jira-apps-gadgets}:image_icon/images/16_16px.gif</link>
   </icon>
.............
</web-item>

The icon showed multiple times as a background for the menu choice that was added. The CSS was not correct.
Actually I did fixed this but not sure I did it the right way. Here is what I did:

I replaced this line

#jira .aui-dd-parent .standard.aui-dropdown li a {color:#333;text-decoration:none; background-color:#fff;}

with this line

#jira .aui-dd-parent .standard.aui-dropdown li a {color:#333;text-decoration:none; background-color:#fff;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-position:5px 5px;padding-left:25px;}

in this two files 

styles\js\widget\dropdown\dropdown.css
styles\js\widget\dropdown\dropdown-min.css

and now is working ok. Thank you

AFTER SUBMITTING THIS BUG AND SAVING FOR SOME REASON THE TEXT ABOVE IS NOT SHOWING THE WAY I ENTERED. COULD BE ANOTHER BUG ISSUE.
PLEASE GO TO EDIT ISSUE MODE TO SEE ALL I ENTERED!
fields.summary: Bug when adding thumbnail (icon) in main JIRA 4.2.2 menu with separate jar file plugin.

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Create a custom field of 'Multi User Picker' type
# Create at least 6 - 10 dummy users in User Browser
# Create a new issue and start to have 2 - 4 users in the Multi User Picker custom field
# The users will appear right below the Reporter field
!MUP_ShowingLikeNormal.jpg|thumbnail!
# However, in IE 8 (8.0.6001 and 8.0.7600) browser, when you increase the number of users in the Multi User Picker custom field until it exceeds the maximum CSS width limit, the user will somehow become 'invisible':
!MUP_Invisible.jpg|thumbnail!

Setting a higher resolution will make the problem go away. Also, using a wider screen or enlarging the IE 8 browser and then press on 'Refresh' button will show all the users. 

This problem does not occur any longer starting from JIRA 4.2.x.
fields.summary: Users in Multi User Picker becomes invisible if the result exceeds the CSS width in IE 8
JIRA Throws 'Property Not Found' Error When Try To Execute The Fix Suggested By The Integrity Checker

fields.description:
If we archive versions, we cannot transition issues for those versions anymore.
But we would still like to be able to handle issues that where found on those versions.

Currently issues with Affects versions that have been archived will fail transitions because the archived version is not found anymore.
We can understand that we cannot fix on archived versions, but issues could still have been found on old versions and still need to be fixed.

Please make archived versions usable (for transitions) in the affects version field (maybe not selectable, but usable once allready selected).
fields.summary: Ability to transition and use issues with archived Affects versions

fields.description:
Hi there, it will be nice if such feature will be implemented:
when new task is being created, we want to use last version number as a default value of 'Fix Version/s' field.

greetings
Marcin Cabaj
fields.summary: 'Fix Version/s' default value

fields.description:
If an issue has an archived Affects or Fix version, cloning the issue fails.
The issue is not duplicated but instead gets clone links from and to itself.

There is no warning to the end user that something is wrong with the issue.

Reproduce (100%):
- Create an issue and set the affects version
- Archive the release set in the affects version
- Try to clone
- Same issue will be shown with relations to itself
fields.summary: Cloning an issue with an archived Affects of Fix version fails

fields.description:
When I wanted to import some issues from a csv file.
So I ran the import wizard.
Then I set the matching of the fields.
I decided to match due date with a field of my csv file.
But when I reached the end of the wizard, I expected to have to configure date format as it is explained in the documentation. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+From+CSV#ImportingDataFromCSV-2.4MiscellaneousInformation.
But nothing appears and it was impossible to import the due date.
I had to add manually these 2 lines : 

date.import.format = dd\/MM\/yyyy
date.fields = Due Date

Then the import worked but I lost a lot of time.
Is there any bug ????

PS : 2 files in attachment : the .csv file and the template to import it
fields.summary: date format is not asked anymore during csv import wizard in step 4 of 5

fields.description:
Sequence of steps to reproduce:

Start a comment
Enter text into comment box
Click "Start Progress" or "Stop Progress"
Screen goes black with spinner in centre
Dialog popup "Are you sure you want to leave this page - you've entered some text" or your browsers equivalent
Click no / cancel
Observe Black screen / spinner remains
Press escape (logical step at that point to clear the screen)
Screen returns to non-black, but the spinner remains.
fields.summary: Start / Stop progress with text entered on issue - spinner remains on screen
Workflow Transition Dialog not marked as dirty

The second option should be removed from the list.

fields.description:
Even if you remove Labels from all screens
and hide it in all field configurations

you can still type the L shortcut
and the Label Editor will pop up 
and let you add labels to the issue.

And the bigger problem:
If you have hidden the Labels system field
and added a labels custom field
then when you press L
you still edit the Labels system field
and not the custom field.

The same thing happens when editing labels in the *IssueNavigator*

In this screenshot from a clean, new Jira 4.2.3 install
note that Labels is hidden and not listed on any screens
!labels hidden.png|thumbnail!

Yet in this screenshot see that I am able to label an issue
that should not have the labels field visible or editable
!labeling issue with no labels field.png|thumbnail!

and in this screenshot see that I should only be editing my Tags custom labels field
but instead pressing L opens the labels editor for the Labels system field.
!system-labels-instead-of-custom-field.png|thumbnail!

For us this is a big problem 
because for many years 
since Jira 3.10
we've been using the labels plugin.
We have had a labels-type custom field called custom tags
and there are now hundreds of thousands of label data 
on hundreds of thousands of issues
for that custom field.

Now as we upgraded to Jira 4.2.3 we'd like to suppress the Labels system field
and continue using our Custom Tags custom labels field.
However, the Labels system field just won't go away
(which reminds me of an earlier suggestion I made about Jira: get rid of [system fields|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21164]. Instead, we're getting more system fields...).
fields.summary: You can always label an issue, even if it's removed from all screens and all configurations

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
1. Create a custom field of Radio Button type (make sure that the Search Template has the value of Radio Button Searcher)
2. Put in a few values into the Radio Button option. For example:
- Team A
- Team B
- Team C
- Team D
- Team E
|
3. Go to Issue Navigator
4. Assuming that selecting 'Team B' in the Radio Button option and then click on 'View'
5. The result for the search is normal, however, the selection option from 'Team B' is now appearing under the most bottom in Radio Button option which is in this example, 'Team E'

In previous JIRA versions (JIRA 4.0.x and JIRA 4.1.x), this behavior does not occur at all.
fields.summary: Selection option is appearing as the most bottom in Radio Button option after searching in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
Some users report the following error when using JIRA with IE7 and IE8:

bq. Raphael is null or not an object. com.atlassian.auiplugin:asj.js line 440

This seems to be restricted to a small subset of users for a given JIRA installation (i.e. it does not affect all users). Atlassian has so far been unable to reproduce the problem, but the probable cause is [this Raphael bug|https://github.com/DmitryBaranovskiy/raphael/issues/158], which is fixed in Raphael v1.4.5 but not in v1.4.4, the version shipped with JIRA.

Screenshot:
!ScriptErrorIE7.jpg|thumbnail!

References:
* http://groups.google.com/group/raphaeljs/browse_thread/thread/10f2e2c31eb823ab?pli=1
* https://github.com/DmitryBaranovskiy/raphael/issues/158
fields.summary: "Raphael is null or not an object" Javascript error when any dropdown is clicked

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Choose any issue in JIRA 
# Attach a screen shot or attach any file which contains images (e.g: jpeg/png)
# After attaching, using IE 7, open the image
# Zoom in the image to a larger scale
# Click on 'Previous' or 'Refresh' twice
# A Javascript error will pop-up:
!Script_Error_IE7.jpg|thumbnail!
# This is how it looks like when I tried accessing the URL again:
!Javascript_IE7_Disabled.jpg|thumbnail! 

This problem does not happen when the image is zoomed out and it does not occur in IE 8 and Firefox. It is also not affecting JIRA 4.0.x and 4.2.x.
fields.summary: Javascript error in IE 7 when images are zoomed in

fields.description:
Our customer have Windows XP (default "cartoon" skin) and IE8 and when he edits the issue, the text in control buttons on the lowest part of the screen is too "squeezed in".

Looks like the problem occurs only when this skin and browser combination is set.
fields.summary: Button text is not well readable

fields.description:
The problem is, that since our upgrade to 4.2.2, our plugin is not working anymore.
I request the data for my config-dialogue via an Ajaxcall to the JIRA REST API. Everything's fine.
But when i want to save my config-dialogue, which triggers a validate action, there's wrong behaviour. 

So, this is what i do:
I have a JAVA Rest API, providing two services: validate and getKpis.
My gagdet calls them with the AJAX framework and everything went fine until now.
From JIRA 4.2.2 on, the string appearing at REST-implementatio is always empty.

To populate the string I use a projectsAndCategoryPicker.

If i take the same .jar file, also with new dependencies, relying on 4.2.2, the plugin does, what it should.


What changed in 4.2.2, which affects my plugin?

I already created a forum thread, but no answer there!?!
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=50897
fields.summary: Empty string from Ajax call
